results.title: Behavior of gases
results.creator_credit: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
The Brownian motion as applicable to smoke particles is shown by photomicrography and compared with a mechanical analogue. Animation is used to develop a model for gas pressure based on chaotic molecular motion. This chaotic motion is contrasted with the orderly behaviour of gases as shown by an experiment illustrating Boyle’s Law. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated

results.title: Elastic collisions and stored energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the concept of stored energy. Uses the example of collisions between two dry-ice pucks. Cylindrical magnets are mounted on the pucks, producing a repelling force, and the kinetic energy of the pucks is measured. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Electric Fields
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Discusses an electric field as a mathematical aid and as a physical entity. Experiments demonstrate the vector addition of fields, the shielding effect by closed metallic surfaces and the electric force which drives an electric current in a conductor.

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Aaron Rogers, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and AFTRS
results.brief_description: This subtle animation is about the chimpanzee, Vlad, who is sent into space during the Cold War. With the dismantling of the Soviet Union he is doomed to wander space as a silent witness to the cruelty and folly of superpower supremacy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aaron Rogers, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and AFTRS
results.description: This subtle animation is about the chimpanzee, Vlad, who is sent into space during the Cold War. With the dismantling of the Soviet Union he is doomed to wander space as a silent witness to the cruelty and folly of superpower supremacy.

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: Luke Dunn Gielmuda, Aaron Rogers and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee sent up to space as a cosmonaut in the middle of the Cold War. With the end of the stand off between the Soviet Union and the West, Vlad is trapped forever in an endless orbit, a victim of humanity and their history. This deceptively simple animation achingly conveys the alienation, terror and ultimate loneliness of the poor animal doomed to wander the cold metallic surfaces of his space pod. Visually and emotionally powerful.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luke Dunn Gielmuda, Aaron Rogers and AFTRS

results.title: Forces
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Stephen White, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Introduces the principles of mechanics by showing the Cavendish experiment which illustrates the gravitational forces between small objects. Also compares gravitational force with magnetic force. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Puberty blues [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Kathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.

results.title: Coulomb's law
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the inverse square relationship between electric force and distance and shows that electric force is directly proportional to charge.

results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.
